summary: We testified about late design changes the Census Bureau has made in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, including potentially ending data collection 30 days earlier than planned and accelerating its data processing (e.g., quality checks). These compressed timeframes raise a number of issues that will require the Bureau's attention, including: Hiring and retaining enough staff to follow up with people who don't respond Monitoring local...
title: 2020 Census: Key Areas for Attention Raised by Compressed Timeframes
